alert.note: Alert for Citrus; Hernando; Pasco; Sumter (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Florida and west central Florida, including the following counties, in central Florida, Sumter. In west central Florida, Citrus, Hernando and Pasco. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 945 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spring Hill, Brooksville, Wildwood, Dade City, Bushnell, St. Leo, Weeki Wachee, Hill n Dale, South Brooksville, North Brooksville, Hernando County Airport, Inverness Highlands South, North Weeki Wachee, Wesley Chapel South, Sugarmill Woods, Lake Panasoffkee, Ridge Manor, San Antonio, Center Hill and Webster. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
